creator: shmulikk@gmail.com
text: Now with the new toolbar allows Find feature, maybe it will be good idea to have CTRL+F open it, instead of the Functions window?

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text: *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 52502 ***

creator: shmulikk@gmail.com
text: As bug 52502 was cancled, I think that there is an agreement on CTRL+F to open the search dialog.

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
Shall we fix this one ?
I personnaly vote for changing CTRL+F to find feature, breaking previous shortcut.
CTRL+F (CMD+F for mac) is kind of standard but if we don't agree, then let's close it.

creator: shmulikk@gmail.com
text:
I think this is accepted by the community as a needed change.
I can send out a question about it again, as I cannot find any relevant thread on this...

The only open question is what will be the new shortcut for the Function Helper? :)

Hello,
Go ahead ask a question and include question shortcut for Function Helper.

Regards
Philippe
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com

text:
Got only one response from Flavio (flaviocysne@gmail.com):
CTRL + W, thinking of something like Function Wizard
or
CTRL + F1, CTRL as function key and F1 from Help :)


I think F1 is standard for help so CTRL + F1 help for fucntions is a nice idea.
It might be good enough also to remove the shortcut for the Function Helper, as I don't think it is very popular.

Anyway - I really support CTRL+F for search, I care less for the Function Helper.
creator: shmulikk@gmail.com
panimaya@bpatech.com
text:
I believe the CTRL+F1 option for Function Helper is a great idea. 
I second shmulikk's opinion that implementing CTRL+F for find would add more value for the community.

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
